messages.subject: Re: Bubbles
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/25/2003 11:50:20 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Oh, there is this cool thing we discovered! There are candy bubbles! You blow them and you
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/25/2003 11:50:20 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> We used a whole litre (quart) of bubble stuff today. We didn't spill it or
> make big bubbles, this was a whole litre used up in dip and blow :-) Mostly
> I blew and the boys chased, then they progressed to trying to bite them.
> Much more fun.
>
> I think we spent a total of two hours on this throughout the day and all
> ages (4 to 38) had fun. We did lots of other stuff, too, but this was a
> really good dampish day for bubbles.
>
>

Oh, there is this cool thing we discovered! There are candy bubbles! You blow
them and you can chase them and lick/bite them and they taste good (well,
sort of...wouldn't want a LOT of it!) I think we got it at KB Toys.


I just found this site that has what they call "Stupid Candy you can play
with." <A HREF="http://www.stupid.com/playwith.htm">http://www.stupid.com/playwith.htm</A>
A toilet shaped plastic package with an edible plunger? Simpsons Pez
dispensers? The rubber chicken pop? Nibble note, paper you can eat? Life doesn't gett
better than this...I think I need to order.

Kathryn, who can just see people shaking their heads in disgust and thinking
"Well, that's where the kid gets it! She takes a sweet bubble-biting post and
turns it into something about mutant candy. No wonder the kid eats sugar all
day!"





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
